messageBody:
Kevin Lawrence wrote:
> Robert Watkins wrote:
>
>>You're _still_ thinking like a programmer... :)
>
> Beg to differ. You are thinking like a programmer and I was just not
> thinking ;-)

*rofl*

> I haven't been able to do it at my current job because my colleagues
> believe that exception messages should not be shown to users :-)

Actually, if you're not showing the exception message directly to users,
it's even _more_ important that the exception has the data needed to make
the message.

The point is that if you make the exception do the message creation, you're
in a position where you can make something else do the message creation
from an exception.
